t: Nahum 1
The*p burden against Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
God’s Wrath on His Enemies
God*pn is*i jealous, and the Lord*s avenges; The*ld Lord*s avenges and is*i furious. The*ld Lord*s will take vengeance on His adversaries, And*ld He reserves wrath*i for His enemies;

The*ld Lord*s is*i slow to anger and great in power, And*ld will not at all acquit the*i wicked.*i The*ln Lord*s has His way In*ld the whirlwind and in the storm, And*ld the clouds are*i the dust of His feet.
He*ld rebukes the sea and makes it dry, And*ld dries up all the rivers. Bashan*ld and Carmel wither, And*ld the flower of Lebanon wilts.
The*ld mountains quake before Him, The*ld hills melt, And*ld the earth heaves at His presence, Yes,*ld the world and all who dwell in it.
Who*ln can stand before His indignation? And*ld who can endure the fierceness of His anger? His*ld fury is poured out like fire, And*ld the rocks are thrown down by Him.
The*ln Lord*s is*i good, A*ld stronghold in the day of trouble; And*ld He knows those who trust in Him.
But*ld with an overflowing flood He*ld will make an utter end of its place, And*ld darkness will pursue His enemies.
What*ln do you conspire against the Lord?*s He*ld will make an utter end of*i it.*i Affliction*ld will not rise up a second time.
For*ld while tangled like*i thorns, And*ld while drunken like*i drunkards, They*ld shall be devoured like stubble fully dried.
From*ld you comes forth one*i Who*ld plots evil against the Lord,*s A*ld wicked counselor.

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Though*pn they*i are*i safe, and likewise many, Yet*ld in this manner they will be cut down When*ld he passes through. Though*ld I have afflicted you, I*ld will afflict you no more;
For*ld now I will break off his yoke from you, And*ld burst your bonds apart.”

The*ln Lord*s has given a command concerning you: “Your*ld name shall be perpetuated no longer. Out*ld of the house of your gods I*ld will cut off the carved image and the molded image. I*ld will dig your grave, For*ld you are vile.”

Behold,*ln on the mountains The*ld feet of him who brings good tidings, Who*ld proclaims peace! O*ld Judah, keep your appointed feasts, Perform*ld your vows. For*ld the wicked one shall no more pass through you; He*ld is utterly cut off.
Nahum 2
The Destruction of Nineveh
He*pn who scatters has come up before your face. Man*ld the fort! Watch*ld the road! Strengthen*ld your*i flanks! Fortify*ld your*i power mightily.
For*ln the Lord*s will restore the excellence of Jacob Like*ld the excellence of Israel, For*ld the emptiers have emptied them out And*ld ruined their vine branches.
The*ln shields of his mighty men are*i made red, The*ld valiant men are*i in scarlet. The*ld chariots come*i with flaming torches In*ld the day of his preparation, And*ld the spears are brandished.
The*ld chariots rage in the streets, They*ld jostle one another in the broad roads; They*ld seem like torches, They*ld run like lightning.
He*ln remembers his nobles; They*ld stumble in their walk; They*ld make haste to her walls, And*ld the defense is prepared.
The*ld gates of the rivers are opened, And*ld the palace is dissolved.
It*ld is decreed: She*ld shall be led away captive, She*ld shall be brought up; And*ld her maidservants shall lead her*i as with the voice of doves, Beating*ld their breasts.
Though*ln Nineveh of old was*i like a pool of water, Now*ld they flee away. “Halt!*ld Halt!” they*i cry;*i But*ld no one turns back.
Take*ld spoil of silver! Take*ld spoil of gold! There*ild is*i no end of treasure, Or*ld wealth of every desirable prize.
She*ld is empty, desolate, and waste! The*ld heart melts, and the knees shake; Much*ld pain is*i in every side, And*ld all their faces are drained of color.
Where*ln is*i the dwelling of the lions, And*ld the feeding place of the young lions, Where*ld the lion walked, the lioness and*i lion’s cub, And*ld no one made them*i afraid?
The*ld lion tore in pieces enough for his cubs, Killed*ld for his lionesses, Filled*ld his caves with prey, And*ld his dens with flesh.

“Behold,*p I am*i against you,” says the Lord*s of hosts, “I will burn your chariots in smoke, and the sword shall devour your young lions; I will cut off your prey from the earth, and the voice of your messengers shall be heard no more.”
Nahum 3
The Woe of Nineveh
Woe*pn to the bloody city! It*ld is*i all full of lies and*i robbery. Its*ild victim never departs.
The*ld noise of a whip And*ld the noise of rattling wheels, Of*ld galloping horses, Of*ld clattering chariots!
Horsemen*ld charge with bright sword and glittering spear. There*ild is*i a multitude of slain, A*ld great number of bodies, Countless*ld corpses— They*ld stumble over the corpses—
Because*ld of the multitude of harlotries of the seductive harlot, The*ld mistress of sorceries, Who*ld sells nations through her harlotries, And*ld families through her sorceries.
“Behold,*ln I am*i against you,” says the Lord*s of hosts; “I*ld will lift your skirts over your face, I*ld will show the nations your nakedness, And*ld the kingdoms your shame.
I*ld will cast abominable filth upon you, Make*ld you vile, And*ld make you a spectacle.
It*ld shall come to pass that*i all who look upon you Will*ld flee from you, and say, ‘Nineveh*ld is laid waste! Who*ld will bemoan her?’ Where*ld shall I seek comforters for you?”
Are*ln you better than No Amon That*ild was*i situated by the River, That*ld had the waters around her, Whose*ld rampart was*i the sea, Whose*ld wall was*i the sea?
Ethiopia*ld and Egypt were*i her strength, And*ld it*i was*i boundless; Put*ld and Lubim were your helpers.

Yet*ld she was*i carried away, She*ld went into captivity; Her*ld young children also were dashed to pieces At*ld the head of every street; They*ld cast lots for her honorable men, And*ld all her great men were bound in chains.
You*ld also will be drunk; You*ld will be hidden; You*ld also will seek refuge from the enemy.
All*ln your strongholds are*i fig trees with ripened figs: If*ld they are shaken, They*ld fall into the mouth of the eater.
Surely,*ld your people in your midst are*i women! The*ld gates of your land are wide open for your enemies; Fire*ld shall devour the bars of your gates.*i
Draw*ln your water for the siege! Fortify*ld your strongholds! Go*ld into the clay and tread the mortar! Make*ld strong the brick kiln!
There*ld the fire will devour you, The*ld sword will cut you off; It*ld will eat you up like a locust. Make*ln yourself many—like the locust! Make*ld yourself many— like the swarming*i locusts!
You*ld have multiplied your merchants more than the stars of heaven. The*ld locust plunders and flies away.

Your*ld commanders are*i like swarming*i locusts, And*ld your generals like great grasshoppers, Which*ld camp in the hedges on a cold day; When*ld the sun rises they flee away, And*ld the place where they are*i is not known.
Your*ln shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria; Your*ld nobles rest in*i the*i dust.*i Your*ld people are scattered on the mountains, And*ld no one gathers them.
Your*ld injury has*i no healing, Your*ld wound is severe. All*ld who hear news of you Will*ld clap their*i hands over you, For*ld upon whom has not your wickedness passed continually?
